content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><xml>   <node>     <title><a href="/issue62/bl-subject-repos-rpt">Subject Repositories: European Collaboration in the International Context</a></title>     <articleSummary>Dave Puplett reports on the conference Subject Repositories: European Collaboration in the International Context held at the British Library in January 2010. The conference launched Economists Online (EO), an innovative economics subject repository.</articleSummary>     <issueNumber><a href="/issue62">issue62</a></issueNumber>     <publishedDate>January Waaijers writes about copyright, prestige and cost control in the world of open access while in two appendices Bas Savenije and Michel Wesseling compare the costs of open access publishing and subscriptions/licences for their respective institutions.</articleSummary>     <issueNumber><a href="/category/issue-number/issue57">issue57</a></issueNumber>     <publishedDate>October
